Articles.Content:
Eeeh, did rev3 works as intended?

Either way all you have to do to fix it should be to reverse the rotation axis in the .cfg (change 1 to -1 or the other way around).

I just kept getting too much engine wobble with the tiltrotors, so I copied the robot rotor, and then copied the tiltrotor settings into it. Was finally able to keep the engines stable enough to fly a heavier craft. Is anyone else seeing hinge instability, or am I the only one? Can\'t reliably tell if it\'s just me, as I mod everything I come into contact with, including this mod.

Anyway, some more tiltrotor stuff:

Anyway, some more tiltrotor stuff:

Where did you get those parts?
They look like standard blender cubes (if you mean the grey ones)

Eeeh, did rev3 works as intended?

Either way all you have to do to fix it should be to reverse the rotation axis in the .cfg (change 1 to -1 or the other way around).

Whether it works or not depends on which side of the craft you put the first one on, AFAIK.

I\'ve been thinking, you know what would be cool? A solar powered electric propeller. With like a battery part, plus a random solar panel, and the propeller drains the battery: low altitude mapping of Kerbin with a blimp without fuel issues.....

The parts are actually an unreleased extension of my LOX/LH2 tanks over here. I just make everything run on either LOX/LH2, or just LH2, keeps the math simple with jet/rocket fuel. Since LH2 weighs practically nothing, the tanks double as structural pieces very nicely. If I can ever be bothered to make them look better, I\'ll release the larger tanks.

@AlexTheStampede-DA\'s rotors, robotics; and my rockets and tanks all use r4m0n\'s Multiversal Mechatronics - Miscellaneous Modules.

I converted Japans engines to run on the fuel I already had, you can just as easily convert them to run on batteries, and there\'s even a purpose-designed solar panel part. While I wouldn\'t go expecting a solar panel plane to airworthy IRL in the immediate future, you\'re free to balance it however you like in your own game.
Found a new use for the propellers and tilt rotors.
I plan on making a ship like that, but then with the purpose to collect all the rubble I\'ve got around the launchpad =P
I pwn3d my trash yesterday by mounting a particle gun on a tilt rotor mount on a truck. Worked great, was fun to watch the debris flying up and then crashing down 8)

I got to high altitude, and my propfans stopped. I can\'t tell if they are still make thrust. I\'m presuming this is an intended feature - efficiency in space would be zero, of course.

Just want to check this is supposed to happen.

Air breathing engines, dude.

It\'s meant to happen.
The engines have an ASL-Vacume thrust curve, I had a grapher, but couldn\'t get a good atm pres formula for it.

We need some SCRAM engines.

With custom sounds.

Just to prove this isn\'t dead:

Just a few hours of work, but you can probably see what I\'m aiming for. But don\'t expect anything new airplane related before .15
Is it a Lockheed TriStar? Looks nice.

Is it a Lockheed TriStar? Looks nice.

Well, it definatly is from my perspective.
Just finished the cockpit mesh.
cold you make the fuslarge holow and have a ramp like c-130 with a lot of nodes inside so that we cold have cargo planes
The problem when there\'s lots of nodes is that it\'s hard to place cargo where you want...

Avatar gunship style ducted coaxial rotors.

I might not be doing the requests in any logical order, but I do try to get them done.
Hey, wait a sec, before you fininish it, could you do a larger version that has stack nodes ? This way we could do the Heinkel-Lerche B2 ?
can you make the in two sizes that one and one a bit bigger and any chance of a winch for robotics
Just wanted to let you know, I think C7 may have gotten a dedicated atmospheric engine module into the code for .15. Not really sure yet, but that would simplify a lot of things code wise.
